title: Understanding the Quotient Rule
text: When dividing expressions with the same base, you subtract the exponents. This is a key property of exponents that relates to the quotient rule.

title: Identifying the Base and Exponents
text: Check if both the numerator and the denominator have the same base in the expression $$\frac{{\left(-2\right)}^{14}}{{\left(-2\right)}^9}$$. Here, both terms are based on the number $$(-2)$$.

title: Applying the Quotient Rule
text: Using the quotient rule, subtract the exponent in the denominator from the exponent in the numerator. This will give you the new exponent of the base.

title: Calculate the Exponent
text: Subtract the exponent in the denominator from the exponent in the numerator: $$14$$ - $$9$$. This will leave you with a single base and the new exponent.

title: Combine the Base and Exponent
text: Now, express the base with the new exponent found. The base remains the same as $$(-2)$$.
